lead_paragraph: The Florida senator, campaigning in New Hampshire, continued to hammer at President Obama’s leadership despite attacks by Chris Christie.

byline.contributor: Nick Corasaniti contributed reporting from Salem, N.H.; Maggie Haberman from Holderness, N.H.; and Thomas Kaplan from Hampton, N.H.
byline.original: By JEREMY W. PETERS and JONATHAN MARTIN

headline.print_headline: Rubio Is Tested as Rivals Sense Vulnerabilities
headline.main: Marco Rubio Comes Back Swinging After Difficult Debate

snippet: The Florida senator, campaigning in New Hampshire, continued to hammer at President Obama’s leadership despite attacks by Chris Christie.
abstract: Sen Marco Rubio confronts fallout from poor debate performance in which he mechanically repeated same statement again and again, giving credence to accusations by New Jersey Gov Chris Christie that Rubio delivers memorized talking points to mask inexperience; is one of most challenging moments for Rubio in campaign, and one his rivals have sought to capitalize on New Hampshire primary approaches.
